BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights:
Over a wide area wind and new snow.
In particular in the regions exposed to heavier precipitation the avalanche prone locations will become more prevalent as the day progresses.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: In the course of the day danger level 3 (considerable) will be reached. In particular adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls and on wind-loaded slopes large and, in isolated cases, very large avalanches are possible as a consequence of the precipitation. Avalanches can be released, even by a single winter sport participant. Backcountry touring calls for experience in the assessment of avalanche danger and careful route selection.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: The fresh snow as well as the wind slabs are bonding poorly with the old snowpack in many places.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The weather will be cold over a wide area.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Until midday the weather will be mild over a wide area. Wet and gliding snow are to be critically assessed.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
On steep grassy slopes more medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large gliding avalanches are possible below approximately 2600 m. Areas with glide cracks are to be avoided.
In the early morning more medium-sized moist and wet avalanches are possible. This applies on steep, rather lightly snow-covered slopes in particular below approximately 2600 m.

In isolated cases wet avalanches can release the saturated snowpack and reach large size. In steep gullies avalanches can in isolated cases reach valley bottoms at relatively high altitudes.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: The snowpack will be wet all the way through. This applies on sunny slopes in all altitude zones, as well as on shady slopes below approximately 2600 m. The surface of the snowpack will only just freeze and will already be soft in the early morning.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Wednesday: Sharp decrease in danger of wet avalanches as the temperature drops.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Until midday the weather will be mild over a wide area. Wet and gliding snow are to be assessed with care and prudence.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
In the early morning more medium-sized moist and wet avalanches are possible. This applies on steep, rather lightly snow-covered slopes in particular below approximately 2500 m. In isolated cases wet avalanches can release the saturated snowpack and reach large size.
On steep grassy slopes more gliding avalanches are possible below approximately 2500 m. Areas with glide cracks are to be avoided.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: The snowpack will be wet all the way through. This applies on sunny slopes in all altitude zones, as well as on shady slopes below approximately 2500 m. The surface of the snowpack will only just freeze and will already be soft in the early morning. In some localities a little new snow to above 2000 m. In isolated cases mostly small wind slabs will form.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Wednesday: Sharp decrease in danger of wet avalanches as the temperature drops. Little snow will fall in some localities.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The wind slabs have bonded quite well with the old snowpack also on wind-protected shady slopes above approximately 3000 m.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Outgoing longwave radiation during the night will be good. As a consequence of falling temperatures the snowpack will consolidate during the next few days.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Towards its surface, the snowpack is moist and its surface has a strong crust. As the day progresses as a consequence of warming during the day there will be an increase in the danger of moist and wet avalanches. In particular adjacent to ridgelines as well as at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions sometimes avalanche prone wind slabs formed.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The weather will be cold. In steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the hard snow surface.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
In some localities light snowfall at intermediate altitudes. The wind will be strong to storm force along the border with France, along the border with Switzerland.
The surface of the snowpack will freeze to form a strong crust and will hardly soften at all. Since Tuesday small wind slabs will form adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls as well as at high altitude. They can be released, even by a single winter sport participant. Even a small avalanche can sweep people along and give rise to falls, especially on very steep slopes.
Significant decrease in danger of moist and wet avalanches as the temperature drops. Only isolated dry and moist snow slides are possible as the day progresses. In the event of prolonged bright spells this applies in particular on rocky slopes.

Individual gliding avalanches can also occur, in particular on very steep grassy slopes. Areas with glide cracks are to be avoided as far as possible.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
Monday: The weather conditions will give rise to consolidation of the old snowpack in all aspects. Gradual decrease in danger of moist and wet avalanches.

In the last few days on very steep slopes further medium-sized and, in many cases, large avalanches were reported. Outgoing longwave radiation during the night was reduced. The surface of the snowpack cooled hardly at all during the overcast night.
Sunday: Sunshine and high temperatures gave rise from the middle of the day to rapid moistening of the snowpack in particular on sunny slopes below approximately 3500 m. The spring-like weather conditions gave rise to rapid settling of the snowpack in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.
Above approximately 2300 m a lot of snow is lying.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Light snowfall. The sometimes storm force wind will transport the new snow. The fresh snow as well as the resulting wind slabs are bonding poorly with the old snowpack.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights:
Over a wide area wind and new snow.
The new snow and wind slabs represent the main danger.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: In particular adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls and on wind-loaded slopes medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large avalanches are possible as a consequence of the precipitation. Avalanches can be released by large loads.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: The fresh snow as well as the resulting wind slabs are bonding poorly with the old snowpack.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The weather will be cold over a wide area.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The wind will transport the loosely bonded old snow.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The wind will be strong to storm force in the regions exposed to the foehn wind. Since Monday mostly small wind slabs formed in particular at high altitude. The wind slabs can be released in all aspects.
Gradual decrease in danger of moist and wet avalanches as the temperature drops. Only isolated avalanches are possible as the day progresses. In the event of solar radiation this applies in particular on rocky slopes.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The snowpack is favourably layered. This applies in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.
Outgoing longwave radiation during the night was reduced. The surface of the snowpack is frozen, but not to a significant depth.

At intermediate and high altitudes there is more snow than usual.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Decrease in danger of wet avalanches as the temperature drops. Wet and gliding snow require caution.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
More medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large gliding avalanches are possible. This applies in particular on steep grassy slopes below approximately 2600 m. Areas with glide cracks are to be avoided.
In the early morning more medium-sized wet avalanches are possible. This applies on very steep slopes below approximately 2600 m.

In isolated cases wet avalanches can release the saturated snowpack and reach large size. In steep gullies avalanches can in isolated cases reach valley bottoms at relatively high altitudes.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The snowpack is wet all the way through. This applies on sunny slopes in all altitude zones, as well as on shady slopes below approximately 2600 m. Some snow will fall in some localities. The meteorological conditions will bring about a gradual strengthening of the snowpack.
The surface of the snowpack will only just freeze and will already be soft in the early morning.

In particular below the tree line only a little snow is now lying.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Decrease in danger of wet avalanches as the temperature drops.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Until midday the weather will be very mild. The danger of wet avalanches will already exist in the early morning.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: On steep grassy slopes mostly small gliding avalanches are possible. From the middle of the day the activity of wet avalanches will gradually decrease.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The surface of the snowpack will freeze very little and will already be soft in the early morning.

Below approximately 1800 m from a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Wednesday: The avalanche danger will decrease.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The backcountry touring conditions are mostly favourable.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The weather will be mostly sunny.
As the temperature drops only isolated small and, in isolated cases, medium-sized loose snow avalanches are possible. In the event of solar radiation this applies in particular on rocky slopes.

The backcountry touring conditions in the morning, after a clear night, are mostly favourable. In steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the hard snow surface.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The snowpack is favourably layered. This applies in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.
The surface of the snowpack has frozen to form a strong crust. The spring-like weather conditions gave rise to rapid settling of the snowpack in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.

In particular at intermediate and high altitudes there is still a very large amount of snow.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Until midday the weather will be very mild. The danger of wet avalanches will already exist in the early morning.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: On steep grassy slopes mostly small gliding avalanches are possible. From the middle of the day the activity of wet avalanches will gradually decrease.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The surface of the snowpack will freeze very little and will already be soft in the early morning.

Below approximately 1800 m from a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Wednesday: The avalanche danger will decrease.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: As a consequence of sharply falling temperatures the snowpack will consolidate during the next few days.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Wet avalanches are still to be expected in the second half of the day.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The snowpack will be in most cases favourable.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The weather will be mostly sunny.
As the temperature drops only isolated small and, in isolated cases, medium-sized loose snow avalanches are possible. In the event of solar radiation this applies in particular on rocky slopes.

The backcountry touring conditions in the morning, after a clear night, are mostly favourable. In steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the hard snow surface.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
The snowpack is favourably layered. This applies in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.
The surface of the snowpack has frozen to form a strong crust. The spring-like weather conditions gave rise to significant settling of the snowpack.

In particular at intermediate and high altitudes there is still a very large amount of snow.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The weather will be cold. In steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the hard snow surface.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
Northwest storm to intermediate altitudes.
The surface of the snowpack will freeze to form a strong crust and will hardly soften at all. Since Tuesday small wind slabs will form in particular in the regions neighbouring those that are subject to danger level 2 (moderate), especially adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas. These can in isolated cases be released, even by a single winter sport participant. Even a small avalanche can sweep people along and give rise to falls.
Significant decrease in danger of moist and wet avalanches as the temperature drops. Only isolated avalanches are possible as the day progresses. In the event of solar radiation this applies in particular on rocky slopes.

Individual gliding avalanches can also occur, in particular on very steep grassy slopes. Areas with glide cracks are to be avoided as far as possible.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
Monday: The weather conditions will give rise to consolidation of the old snowpack in all aspects. Gradual decrease in danger of dry and wet avalanches.

In the last few days on very steep slopes further medium-sized avalanches were reported.
The surface of the snowpack cooled hardly at all during the overcast night. Outgoing longwave radiation during the night was reduced. Sunday: Sunshine and high temperatures gave rise from the middle of the day to rapid moistening of the snowpack in particular on sunny slopes below approximately 3500 m. The spring-like weather conditions gave rise to rapid settling of the snowpack in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.
Above approximately 2300 m a lot of snow is lying.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The weather will be cold. In some localities light snowfall. The sometimes storm force wind will transport only a little snow.
